medical_history.chief_complaint: Fatigue, achiness, and dyspnea on exertion attributed to sarcoidosis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after diagnosis in spring 2005, with variable but sometimes intense fatigue, general achiness (especially in legs), and exertional dyspnea. Symptoms include annual wintertime episodes of shortness of breath diagnosed as bronchitis. Symptoms have not changed dramatically over the past year; dyspnea is worst when climbing stairs, and lower extremity achiness and weakness come and go.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Two cesarean deliveries; moderate anemia attributed to sarcoidosis.
medical_history.family_history: Recent diagnosis of sarcoidosis in brother presenting with night sweats and weight loss. Paternal grandfather had presumed tuberculosis, potentially sarcoidosis.
medical_history.social_history: Never smoked; drinks alcohol in moderation.
